definition[0]: to order someone to come to a place
example[0]: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
example[1]: The president summoned Taylor to Washington.
example[2]: He was summoned to attend an emergency meeting.
definition[1]: to officially order someone to come to a court of law
example[3]: Hugh was summoned to appear before the magistrate.
definition[2]: to try very hard to have enough of something such as courage, energy, or strength, because you need it
example[4]: He had to summon the energy to finish the race.
